availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick William Krueskamp (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, liquor store owner)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, liquor store owner. Native of Hanover. Son of William Krueskamp and Allice Krueskamp. Married to Emily Krueskamp. Father of John Krueskamp, William Krueskamp, Frederick Krueskamp, Henry Krueskamp, and Emma Krueskamp. Owned and operated a liquor store at Craig Street and Lexington Pike in Covington in 1860. Employed Edward Markwoot as a clerk and Catherine Helmich as a servant in Kenton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 268.
Williams' Covington Directory: City Guide (1861), U.S. City Directories, 1822-1995., Covington, Kentucky, p. 452, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records (1774-1989), Clerk of the County Court, Kenton County, Kentucky, p. 232, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
